content: Identify the primary conflict in the movie "Titanic".

The primary conflict in the movie "Titanic" is the struggle between human ambition and nature, represented by the ship's ill-fated maiden voyage and its collision with an iceberg. This external conflict is compounded by the internal and interpersonal struggles of the characters, particularly the love story between Jack Dawson and Rose DeWitt Bukater, who come from different social classes. Their romance faces societal pressures and personal dilemmas amidst the impending disaster.
